import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
from enum import Enum

class UsageOption(Enum):
    EQNRateWFX = "Equinor Rate with Forex Increases"
    EQNRateWOFX = "Equinor Rate without Forex Increases"
    Retail = "Retail"
    NotApplicable = "NotApplicable"

class Lookback(Enum):
    SixMonth = "6 Month Forecast"
    OneYear = "1 Year Forecast"
    TwoYear = "2 Year Forecast"
    Full = "Entire History Forecast"
    NotApplicable = "NotApplicable"

class SubsurfaceScenario(Enum):
    ANFHighCase = "ANF High Case"
    ANFLowCase = "ANF Low Case"
    QumuloHighCase = "Qumulo High Case"
    QumuloLowCase = "Qumulo Low Case"
    NotApplicable = "NotApplicable"

class SAPScenario(Enum):
    Standard = "Standard"
    Migration = "Migration"
    NotApplicable = "NotApplicable"

class ConsumptionType(Enum):
    Organic = "Organic"
    InOrganic = "In-Organic"

# Load Equinor Rate with Forex Increases predictions
billing_path = f"abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/cumulative-cost-prediction.parquet/**"
billing_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(billing_path)

# Load Equinor Rate without Forex Increases predictions
adjusted_billing_path = f"abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/adjusted-cumulative-cost-prediction.parquet/**"
adjusted_billing_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(adjusted_billing_path)
## Load contribution predictions for the in-organic consumption
## Split prediction/forecast table into flat tables

prediction_columns = [
    'PredictedCost6MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCost12MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCost24MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCostFullLookback'
]

prediction_column_mapping = {
    'PredictedCost6MonthLookback': Lookback.SixMonth.value,
    'PredictedCost12MonthLookback': Lookback.OneYear.value,
    'PredictedCost24MonthLookback': Lookback.TwoYear.value,
    'PredictedCostFullLookback': Lookback.Full.value

def compute_aggregated_forecasts(df, usage_option):
    schema = T.StructType([
        T.StructField("Year", T.IntegerType(), False),
        T.StructField("ConsumptionForecast", T.DoubleType(), False),
        T.StructField("Lookback", T.StringType(), True)
    ])

    total_df = spark.createDataFrame([], schema)

    df = df \
        .select('Date', *prediction_columns) \
        .where((F.col('Date') >= '2025-01-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2029-12-01')) \
        .withColumn('Year', F.year('Date'))
    
    for column in prediction_columns:
        current_df = df.alias(f'{column}_df')
        current_df = current_df.select('Year', column)
        current_df = current_df.withColumnRenamed(column, 'ConsumptionForecast')
        current_df = current_df.groupBy('Year').agg(F.sum('ConsumptionForecast').alias('ConsumptionForecast'))
        current_df = current_df.withColumn('Lookback', F.lit(prediction_column_mapping[column]))

        total_df = total_df.union(current_df)

    total_df = total_df.withColumn('UsageOption', F.lit(usage_option))
    
    return total_df

agg_billing_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(billing_df, usage_option=UsageOption.EQNRateWFX.value)
agg_adjusted_billing_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(adjusted_billing_df, usage_option=UsageOption.EQNRateWOFX.value)
agg_retail_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(retail_df, usage_option=UsageOption.Retail.value)

consumption_forecast_df = agg_billing_df.union(agg_adjusted_billing_df).union(agg_retail_df)
## Flatten all forecast tables and combine into single dataframe

consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('Project',
    F.when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.SixMonth.value, F.lit('Baseline - Forecast based on last 6 months usage - includes organic growth'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.OneYear.value, F.lit('Baseline - Forecast based on last 1 years usage - includes organic growth'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.TwoYear.value, F.lit('Baseline - Forecast based on last 2 years usage - includes organic growth'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.Full.value, F.lit('Baseline - Forecast based on usage from entire history - includes organic growth'))
)

consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('SubScenario', F.lit(SubsurfaceScenario.NotApplicable.value))
consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('SapScenario', F.lit(SAPScenario.NotApplicable.value))
consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('ConsumptionType', F.lit(ConsumptionType.Organic.value))
## Combine organic and in-organic contributions into single dataframe
